comments:
I wanted to open a report created with Eclipse BIRT 2.1.X, and I get the 
following error:
An error has occurred. See error log for more details.
 
In the error log, I get the exception attached at the end of this post. I 
can create a new report and work with it, but it seems that the XML format 
of the rptdesign of version 2.2 has some elements which must not occur in 
version 2.1. I tried with Eclipse 3.3, and I tried with JDK 1.5 and 1.6. The 
error persists.

I tried to remove all <height> and <property name="height"> tags in the XML, 
but the error still persists.

I could not find the XSD to validate the XML, therefore, I'm really stuck. I 
see only two solutions:
a) Create the report anew with 2.2 (which takes some time)
b) Try to remove XML snippet by XML snippet and retry to open the report 
   until the XML tag which creates the problem is located.

Does anybody have other ideas? 

Regards
Michael

Created an attachment (id=73410)
RPTDEsign file which raises a NoSuchField exception when opened

It looks like the FontData class has a public member height, but this public member is a float, and getMinimumFontSize returns it as int. I tried to reproduce it with a little class, but this class won't compile, because Java cannot cast automatically from float to int. Hope that helpss
Are you using BIRT 2.1.x with Eclipse3.3? The supported eclipse environment for BIRT 2.1.x is 3.2.

I tried BIRT 2.2 with Eclipse 3.3. Now I downloaded the full package version (All-In-One), and with this one, it works. The problem seems to have been due to the Eclipse version. The bug can be closed from my point of view.
